title: MBTA Hingham ferry service canceled for Feb. 13 due to ice in the harbor
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: MBTA canceled Hingham/Hull ferry service for Feb. 13 due to thick ice in Boston Harbor.
Shuttle buses will operate from Nantasket Beach to Hull Ferry Terminal from 6:30 a.m. to 10:35 p.m.
Recent snowstorm caused unusual ice buildup, leading to more frequent ferry cancellations this winter.

title: Retired Gloucester firefighter dies days after being struck by Lowell police cruiser
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Daniel Kennedy, 60, a retired Gloucester firefighter, died after being struck by a Lowell police cruiser at UMass Lowell.
The incident occurred on February 5 on Wilder Street; Kennedy died from his injuries at Lahey Hospital on February 12.
The Middlesex District Attorney's Office is investigating the crash alongside Massachusetts State Police and other agencies.

title: 5 players on Red Sox’ roster bubble entering spring training
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Triston Casas may start 2026 in Triple-A Worcester due to health concerns and roster competition with Willson Contreras.
Kristian Campbell could return to Worcester, facing challenges from defensive struggles and competition for designated hitter roles.
Pitchers Payton Tolle and Connelly Early might open in Worcester amid competition in the Red Sox's crowded rotation.

title: Plans confirmed for new ICE facility in N.H.; documents reveal state officials knew for weeks
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: State officials in New Hampshire knew about plans for a new ICE facility in Merrimack as early as January 12.
Governor Kelly Ayotte's administration is facing scrutiny over knowledge of the facility, leading to a commissioner's resignation.
The Merrimack ICE facility is estimated to cost $158 million to renovate and have a capacity of 400 to 600 beds.

title: Ex-Patriots coach Dante Scarnecchia isn’t panicking over Will Campbell’s play
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots' rookie Will Campbell allowed 14 pressures in Super Bowl loss, raising concerns over his position.
Former coach Dante Scarnecchia supports Campbell remaining at left tackle, citing his potential and previous performance.
Patriots' coaches confirmed Campbell will stay at left tackle, with offseason training suggested to address performance issues.

title: Video: Mike Vrabel shares message to distraught Patriots after Super Bowl loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mike Vrabel consoled New England Patriots players after their 29-13 Super Bowl LX defeat to the Seattle Seahawks.
Vrabel emphasized unity and future prospects, telling his team they have many more days of football ahead.
Despite the loss, Vrabel viewed the 2025 season as successful, reflecting on strong team development and 14 regular-season wins.

title: Patriots reportedly make changes to coaching staff, move Williams to ‘high-ranking’ role
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots' Terrell Williams moves to a high-ranking role, prompting a search for a new defensive coordinator.
Zak Kuhr, interim defensive play-caller, is the leading candidate to become the Patriots' full-time defensive coordinator.
Williams returns to work cancer-free, after stepping away in 2025 due to prostate cancer, and supports Kuhr's performance.

title: Pittsfield man, 69, killed in hit-and-run crash that dragged him ‘lengthy distance,’ DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: William Colbert, 69, was killed in a hit-and-run in Pittsfield after being dragged by a car late Tuesday night.
The accident occurred near Linden Street and Francis Avenue; Colbert's body was discovered on West Housatonic Street.
Police are searching for a dark-colored sedan involved in the incident; the driver fled the scene.

title: ‘This is only the beginning’: Ann Michael Maye shares encouraging message after Patriots Super Bowl loss
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Ann Michael Maye thanked God and supporters on Instagram after the Patriots' 29-13 Super Bowl loss to the Seahawks.
Quarterback Drake Maye set a Super Bowl record with 235 passing yards in a quarter despite losing the game.
Drake Maye looks forward to spending the offseason with his wife, Ann Michael, who gained popularity for her 'Bakemas' videos.

title: This dad is running Boston to give back to Boston Children’s Hospital
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Nick Gallagher, 38, from Plymouth, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon for Boston Children's Hospital's Miles for Miracles team.
Gallagher's motivation is his son, who received life-changing neurological care at Boston Children's Hospital since birth four years ago.
Funds raised from his marathon participation aim to support Boston Children's Hospital's continued care for children and their families.
